Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in the third inning, giving the Yankees a 5-2 lead.
Anthony Volpe added a double, a walk, three runs, and a great play in the field.
Austin Wells hit a solo homer in the sixth inning.
Five Yankees relievers combined for five scoreless innings, allowing just one hit.
The Yankees scored five runs in the eighth inning, breaking the game open.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees faced a potential sweep but came back to beat the Dodgers, 11-4, in Game 4 at Yankee Stadium.
The Yankees' bullpen made up for a poor outing by rookie starter Luis Gil, and Volpe and Wells combined to reach base six times.
No. 9 hitter Alex Verdugo drove in two runs for the Yankees.
Manager Aaron Boone turned to Luke Weaver in the seventh inning to face Mookie Betts and Freeman.
Aaron Judge finally got a hit, drove in a run, and went all night without a strikeout.
Post-Match Reflections: Luke Weaver described the win as 'pretty, monumentally huge,' and the energy re-surfaced for the Yankees.
Anthony Volpe said, 'The win’s hit me, nothing else has hit me yet.'
Jazz Chisholm Jr. said, 'We love making history,' and referenced the team's new mantra of making history despite trailing 3-1 in the series.
Clay Holmes said, 'We know it’s not over yet.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Daniel Hudson served up a grand slam in the third inning, which may have cost the Yankees a chance to tie the game.
The game went into the eighth inning before the Yankees broke open the game with five runs.
Yankees closer Luke Weaver struck out Mookie Betts on five pitches in the seventh inning.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts was able to give the rest of his 'A' bullpen the night off, while the Yankees bullpen was taxed heavily.
Others: Freddie Freeman hit a fourth home run of the series, giving the Dodgers a 2-0 lead in the first inning.
Gerrit Cole will start for the Yankees in Game 5, facing Jack Flaherty, the Dodgers' Game 1 starter.
The Yankees will turn to ace Gerrit Cole on Wednesday, and the Dodgers will counter with mid-season acquisition Jack Flaherty.
